Have not got many hours on this on steam but have previously completed this on my xbox360. First of I would like to say that the basic mechanics are very good and are interesting because they have not really been explored before in any game. I will break this review down into several parts but it will not be too long.

Story- you may think a puzzle game like this may not have a good story but its better than good. Its easy to understand but has enough twists and turns to make this story engaging and interesting. It is also full of jokes that are quite subtle and some not so subtle. My favourite character was wheatly (played by steven merchant) as he was funny and kind of adorable in parts. But Glad0s was also halarious and intreging as she occasionally gives you clues about your parents.

Gameplay- It gives you very little to play with at the outset but as the game pushes forward it gets a lot harder and gives you more means to complete the chambers. It gives you a new mechanic, lets you master it and then introduces you to more and this repeats throughout the game to keep portal from getting stale.

Graphics- Runs on the source engine (sorry if I am wrong) which is what most if not all of valves games use. The graphics are very simple but timeless as the is never much colour in most of the game in this bleak, torn apart testing facility. Portal 2 will run on most computers and runs on my laptop which runs games like complete crap.

Extra- There is little to no lore in the portal universe at the moment but they still hav loads of good easter eggs like singing turrets and the lab rat location which are really eerie and creepy. I love the music for portal and have bought the soundtrack for portal and portal 2. This is my favourite valve game along with left 4 dead 2 and I would recomend it to pretty much anyone. R.I.P spelling.

Let me start off by saying that I am a huge Valve fan. I love everything Valve, and so my review might be a little biased. But I don't think that really matters when everyone thinks the same about this puzzle solving game.

First, let's talk graphics. I've tried out the original Portal demo before ever playing Portal 2, and when I saw the graphics in Portal 2 I was honestly stunned. It looked amazing for it's time and it still holds up pretty well today, considering the fact that it was made 4 years ago, in 2011. While it may not look as good as most titles from the years between the game's release and now, I believe that the graphics has done it's job perfectly. It creates an atmosphere that almost makes you feel like you're there, trapped within the Aperture Laboratories with the rogue A.I. GLaDOS as you solve puzzles to try and escape the facility.

Now we move on to gameplay. If you've played the original Portal, then this would feel similar, but different. Valve has made many tweaks to the movement and the portal mechanics. An example of this is the fact that portals no longer actually travel, they just appear when you shoot them instead of flying through the air like in the original. This prevents you from shooting a portal in a portal like the original. The gel mechanic added quite a bit to Portal 2. It gave the players a way to alter your usual movement in the form of 3 gels: Repulsion Gel, that is blue in color and allows you to bounce on it to reach higher elevations; Propulsion Gel, that is orange in color and speeds you up when running across the gel; and Conversion Gel, which is white in color and allows you to place a Portal on any surface that the gel covers. These 3 gels add variety to the game, without completely straying away from the fact that it's mainly about the portals.

The sound. The sound design in this game is superb. It adds to the atmosphere that the graphics visually create, without being too over the top. All the ambient noises you hear while walking through the ruined facility, the dripping water, falling rocks... it all feels like it's actually there. The music is amazing too. It perfectly fits the puzzles you are solving and are nice to listen to when thinking. It's so good that I listen to it in my spare time (or maybe I just love Soundtrack.)

Now to the final part, the story. The story, that was nearly non-existant in the first game, became a huge narrative with a ton of lore of its own; and as Valve has shown, time and time again, that they are excellent at crafting lore. Every character got a backstory, be it with the dialogue, the secrets in the game or even the comic that Valve released. It became a great story that matched the puzzle game mechanics of equal proportions. The characters that Valve had created were so rich in personality, I couldn't help but play the game again and again just to see those characters again.

I highly recommend this game to anyone who enjoys atmospheric environments, puzzle solving, and lore.

真！的！是！太！好！玩！了！
  表示入了之后自己玩单人的时候是当英语听力材料的233  入这个的原因还是因为dota2我有个那个机器人的语音包。
和基友一起玩的时候根本停不下来，连玩两天把双人合作的六关打穿了，2个机器人搞基互相陷害也是常有的，还有经常会通过物理系统卡bug过关也是特别的喜感。机器人撞墙的样子真的是太搞笑了，特别是那个矮圆的。其实我是有点没玩够的，如果官方能出多人合作dlc我肯定买买买。【虽然我知道有创意工坊】
  
大部分的谜题还是在正常水平的。不过后面有几关没告诉你有些机关到底有什么用以及场地该怎么用，需要你自己去想用法[spoiler] 比如合作第6关最后那个透明的胶体其实是水。。以及那个装着箱子的其实是玻璃 [/spoiler] 会让人比较烧脑子。

  我感觉v社这个合作模式系统本身做的也非常地用心，能使用标记完成合作，还能看对方的视角来帮助解谜，机器人之间的互动动作也非常有趣。

============================之后添加的评论============================
当我因为硬盘空间不足把这款游戏删了的时候【11G】，才想起我好像之前只评论了多人模式，于是这里再讲讲单人故事模式吧。
主线的解谜部分都还设计的不错费一定的脑子又有成就感。但是，有很多非关卡内容会很容易卡关，因为需要你自己仔细去找那些放置传送门的地点以及过关方法。
剧情以及对话都设计的很有意思。虽然是以老套的人工智能为核心的故事，但是GLaDOS 和另外一个球充满个性的配音让演出效果大大加分，而且合时宜的吐槽让那些烧脑的解谜过程不会过于烦躁或者觉得无聊， 带点阴谋论又科幻的剧情也是极好的，具体的剧情我也不打算多谈论，大家自己去体验。
